body.p: The Delete I/O Submission Queue command is used to delete a submission queue previously created with the Create I/O Submission Queue command. This command causes all commands issued to the indicated Submission Queue that are still in progress to be aborted. The controller does not need to post individual completion status for commands that have been aborted. Commands that cannot be aborted should be completed with appropriate completion status.

fig.title: Delete I/O Submission Queue Command Control Flow

table.title: Delete I/O Submission Queue Command Control Flow

entry.p: The command is received by one of the Data Managers.
The Data Manager forwards the command to the Admin Command Manager for processing.
The Admin Command Manager disables the submission queue engine and updates its internal state to reflect that the submission queue has been deleted.
The Admin Command Manager issues queue map delete requests to all of the Data Managers.
The Data Managers update their internal queue map state to reflect the new queue mapping.
The Data Manager responds to the Admin Command Manager with a queue map delete completion message.
The Admin Command Manager sends a completion queue update request to the Completion Manager.
The Completion Manager replies back to the Admin Command Manager when the completion has been successfully sent to the host.
